text: The Philippines has competed at every iteration of the Asian Para Games which was first held in Guangzhou, China. The Philippines has won a total of 46 medals in its participation in the Asian Para Games as of the 2018 edition; 10 of which are gold, 17 of which are silver, and 19 of which are bronze. The Philippines would participate in the third edition of the Games in Jakarta, Indonesia from October 6-13, 2018. ==Asian Games== ===Medals by Games=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="margin-top:0em; text-align:center; font- size:100%;" !Games !style="width:4em;"|Rank !style="background:gold; width:4em;"|Gold !style="background:silver; width:4em;"|Silver !style="background:#cc9966; width:4em;"|Bronze !style="width:4em;"|Total |- |style="text-align:left"| 2010 Guangzhou || 21 || 0 || 4 || 3 || 7 |- |style="text-align:left"| 2014 Incheon || 24 || 0 || 5 || 5 || 10 |- |style="text-align:left"| 2018 Jakarta ||11 || 10 || 8 || 11 || 29 |- ! Total !! 11 !! 10 !! 17 !! 19 !! 46 |} ==See also== *Philippines at the Asian Games ==References== Category:Nations at the Asian Para Games
title: Philippines at the Asian Para Games
